channel.title: Wall error.. With pic explained!
channel.description:
Hello, I wanted to delete a wall from that house. But if I add that code to public void deletethatobject it doesnt work. But why? it is on the middle on both so I tryed them both but no one helped.. whats wrong??!
[URL=http://imageshack.us][IMG]http://img228.imageshack.us/img228/4742/wallerrorzzlt0.jpg[/img][/URL] [URL=http://g.imageshack.us/img228/wallerrorzzlt0.jpg/1/][IMG]http://img228.imageshack.us/img228/wallerrorzzlt0

item.title: Wall error.. With pic explained!
item.dc:creator: @mod_lol1 mod_lol1
item.description:
@mod_lol1 wrote:

look this is what I used to delete the wall :

[code]public void deletethatobject(int objectX, int objectY) {
ReplaceObject2(objectX, objectY, 6951, -1, 10);
}
public void Deleteobjects() {

	   deletethatobject(3079, 3507);
	   deletethatobject(3079, 3506);

}

[/code]

what I need to make the code rite?

Read full topic

item.title: Wall error.. With pic explained!
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Here is some general code regarding removing an object:

	public void removeObject(CustomObject object) {
		player.getIoSession().write(new StaticPacketBuilder().setId(60).setSize(Packet.Size.VariableShort)
				.addByte((byte)(object.getY() - (player.getLocation().getRegionY() * 8)))
				.addByte((byte)-(object.getX() - (player.getLocation().getRegionX() * 8)))
				.addByte((byte)101).addShort(0).toPacket());
	}

This basically means that all you need is the coordinates. Make sure that your coordinates are correct and the base you are using properly converts the absolute coordinates of the house to local coordinates. You can also check to see if your method for deleting objects follows the same lines as the above code. Finally, try calling the method more than once, forcing a flush of the data after the packet is written to the stream, or have two open clients, both connected to your server when you test the removal of the object.

Just a few suggestions.

Read full topic
